ACT
223
Referral to litigation due to a dispute over the right to record or other right to inheritance
If there are disputed facts between the parties on which the right to a will-specified record or other right depends, the court will refer the parties to litigation or proceedings before an administrative body, but will not terminate the probate proceedings.
If in the case referred to in paragraph 1 of this article there is no dispute about facts, but only about the application of law, the probate court will discuss these legal issues in the probate proceedings.
